content: In those days Hezekiah [king of Judah] became sick and was at the point of death. And Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, came to him and said, “For the  says this, ‘Set your house in order  prepare a will, for you shall die; you will not live.’”
Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the ,

and said, “Please, O , just remember how I have walked before You in faithfulness  truth, and with a whole heart [absolutely devoted to You], and have done what is good in Your sight.” And Hezekiah wept greatly.
Then the word of the  came to Isaiah, saying,
“Go and say to Hezekiah, ‘For the , the God of David your father says this, “I have heard your prayer, I have seen your tears; listen carefully, I will add fifteen years to your life.
I will rescue you and this city from the hand of the king of Assyria; and I will defend this city [Jerusalem].”’
“This shall be the sign to you from the , that the  will do this thing that He has spoken:

Listen carefully, I will turn the shadow on the stairway [denoting the time of day] ten steps backward,  on the stairway (sundial) of Ahaz.” And the sunlight went ten steps backward on the stairway where it had [previously] gone down.
writing of Hezekiah king of Judah after he had been sick and had recovered from his illness:
Now Isaiah had said, “Have them take a cake of figs and rub it [as an ointment] on the inflamed spot, that he may recover.”
